The pathogenesis of complex diseases as well as the adaptive stress response, inflammation, and senescence are multistep processes which involve extracellular and intracellular communications at differing stages of stress regulation and cannot be limited to the few biochemical interactions that occur in the brain or other tissues. Clearly, for the description of the mechanism of action of adaptogens the reductionist model that assumes a single drugâ€”single receptor interaction is insufficient and not valid.
